text:
- [Jeff] Hi everyone,
my name is Jeff Bartley
and I am a Principal Product Manager

on the AWS DataSync team
and I'm excited to talk
to you today more about Datasync
and how it can help you move your data
to and from AWS and other cloud providers.

AWS solutions for hybrid and
multicloud span multiple areas

including management and
governance, observability,

data and analytics,
compute, and containers.

In this video, we're gonna
focus on data and analytics.
AWS data and analytics services enable you
to gain insights from all of your data
whether it's stored on AWS, on premises,

in SaaS applications, or
in other cloud databases
and analytics services.

A first step to gaining
insights from your data

is making sure your data is
available and accessible.

AWS DataSync provides
capabilities to move data

between AWS storage,
on-premises file systems,
and other cloud storage services,

helping you get your data
where it needs to be.
AWS DataSync is a secure, managed service

that automates and accelerates
the movement of data online
between storage systems
without the need to write and run scripts
to manage your data transfers.
With DataSync, you can access data

from a variety of
supported storage locations
spanning on-premises, edge,
and other cloud storage services,
and then move it to and from AWS

to support your business
workflows and data processing.
AWS DataSync enables you
to easily manage data movement workloads

with bandwidth throttling,
migration scheduling,
and task filtering.

You can also rapidly
migrate file and object data

to the cloud for data
replication or archival.

And DataSync helps you simplify
your migration planning

and reduce costs typically
associated with data movement.
Here's a bit more detail on AWS DataSync
and the value we deliver to customers.

Performance is critical
to any migration tool,
and DataSync has been built for speed.

It utilizes compression,
parallel transfers,

and other optimizations
to transfer your data
as fast as possible.

With built-in scheduling,
filtering, and logging,
DataSync is easy to use,
helping you get up and running quickly
so you can focus on the task
of getting your data to the cloud.
Security is our top priority
here at AWS, and we built DataSync

to transfer your data
securely and reliably.
DataSync encrypts data in flight
and supports encryption at rest.

In addition, DataSync
provides a number of options
for data integrity verification,

ensuring all of your data
is transferred successfully.

As a fully managed service,
DataSync takes care

of securely connecting
to AWS storage services

and integrates with common
AWS management tools

such as CloudWatch,
CloudTrail, and EventBridge.

Finally, DataSync was
designed to be cost-effective

at 1.25 cents per gigabyte
of data transferred.

With DataSync, you pay only
for the data you transfer,
and there are no minimums.

DataSync makes it simple
to move large amounts
of data quickly and securely
between on-premises data centers,

edge locations or outpost
environments, and AWS.
You can also use DataSync to transfer data
between your AWS storage.

DataSync can copy data to and
from your Amazon S3 buckets,
Amazon EFS file systems,
and all Amazon FSx file system types.

Additionally, DataSync
can be used to move data
to and from storage in other clouds

including Google Cloud
Storage, Azure Files,
and Azure Blob storage,

which we're going to talk
about more in this video.
DataSync supports using the internet,
VPN, or direct connect to transfer data

between your on-premises or
cloud environments and AWS.
Regardless of which method you use,
all data is encrypted in-flight using TLS.
With support for Azure Blob storage,

you can now use DataSync
to easily move data

the same way you would with
other supported locations.

DataSync can read from
all Azure Blob types
and also supports Azure Blob containers

configured for Data Lake
Storage Generation Two.

Using DataSync, you can move
your data quickly and securely
from Azure Blob to Amazon S3, Amazon EFS,
or Amazon FSx file systems.

When moving data from
Azure Blob to Amazon S3,

DataSync preserves
object tags and metadata.
A common challenge for customers working
in multi-cloud environments
is moving data from other clouds
into AWS, particularly at scale.

Customers looking to populate
their data lakes in Amazon S3

can now pull data directly
from Azure Blob using DataSync.
DataSync can access data in Azure Blob
or Azure Data Lake Storage

whether that data is
stored by the customer,

by third parties, or stored in
publicly available data sets.

Using DataSync, you can
access data in Azure Blob
and move it to AWS quickly and securely

without the headaches of
do-it-yourself solutions

or the costs of expensive
commercial tools.

To learn more about DataSync,
check out our product page
at aws.amazon.com/datasync.

You'll find detailed
information about the service

along with links to blogs,
documentation, and more.
You can also go to the AWS console
and get started moving your data today.
